title: Villa And Zapata A Biography of the Mexican Revolution by Frank
description:
Recounting the decade of bloody events that followed
the eruption of the Mexican Revolution in 1910, Villa
and Zapata explores the regional, international,
cultural, racial, and economic strife that made the
rebels Francisco (Pancho) Villa and Emiliano Zapata
legends. Throughout this volume drama colludes with
history, in a tale of two social outlaws who became
legendary national heroes, yetÃ¯Â¿Â½despite their triumph
and only meeting, in 1914, in the Mexican
capitalÃ¯Â¿Â½failed to make common cause and ultimately
fell victim to intrigues more treacherous than their
own. 16 pages of black-and-white photographs bring
this gripping narrative to life. "McLynn ... tells
it so well ... you can hear the strains of he Mexican
patriotic standard `Zacatecas' as you read it.

Villa and Zapata: A History of the Mexican Revolution
By: Frank McLynn
ISBN13: 9781448114566
Format: EPUB
Language: EN
Pages: 1201
